Key Match Events: Alperen Sengun led the way for Houston with 23 points, six rebounds, four assists, and six steals
Jalen Green added 22 points for Houston
Quentin Grimes scored a team-high 17 points off the bench for Dallas
Kyrie Irving was held to just 16 points by the Rockets defense
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockets ended their two-game losing streak by beating the Mavs 110-99
The Mavericks are also trying to survive during the absence of Luka Doncic, who is out for a month with a calf injury
Others: After a back-and-forth first half, the Rockets ended their two-game losing streak by beating the Mavs 110-99
In the first quarter, the Dallas Mavericks built an early 10-point lead because of Klay Thompson's hot shooting
The Rockets immediately fought back and even got the lead in just four minutes
Thompson had eight points for Dallas, while Kyrie Irving was pretty quiet with zero points in two shots
Dillon Brooks and Jalen Green led the way for Houston in the first 12 minutes with eight points each
The Houston Rockets continued to pad their lead in the third quarter with their hot shooting and impressive defense
Dallas tried their best to make a comeback, but their turnovers were costly and they couldn't make enough to get some momentum
With their win, the Rockets improved 22-11 for the season to remain in the third spot in the Western Conference standings
The Mavs have now lost three in a row and dropped to 20-14
